title: Stuck In Bronze For Life
body:
Lets discuss:

I have over 150 wins in Ranked play this season, but I'm still in bronze 5. Why? Well, we all have our bad games, I'm a grown up and can take responsibility, but let's discuss how this game requires 5 people (sometimes 4) to win a game. As a player with nearly 2000 games played I can offer advice to other players on what tactics to use to win a game or battle. But, how do most players receive that advice? Every once in a while you get the, "thanks for that, sounds good let's try it," but mostly you get, "KYS", "STFU UR TRASH", etc.

Reporting these players is fine, but that doesnt save your league points or advancement possibility.

Let's not even get into those who just troll, whether a jinx jungle or shaco adc or veigar top. Yesterday I had a jungle veigar.

The thing is, I could understand being matched up with these players in solo/duo queue if I were less than 50 games into the ranked league. But I have over 150 wins, have been to silver 5 and bronze 1 multiple times and back down. Shouldn't I be playing with some more experienced players?

This brings me to my solution. If RIOT were to add more divisions below bronze, like iron, steel, wood, etc., then the inexperienced, bad players, and trolls would occupy a lower division and allow other players to move up into higher ELO.

I wouldn't mind queuing for longer times to play with players of similar experience. I look through my ranked divisions and see that there are players with over 300 wins in bronze 5. They shouldn't be there. Maybe once you reach a certain number of wins you get locked at a level which you cant fall below for that season.

It just seems that it's nearly impossible to rise out of bronze and silver with the volume of trolls and players who refuse to work as a team or accept advice from more experienced players this season.

Thanks for hearing me out.

Bruno

>It just seems that it's nearly impossible to rise out of bronze and silver with the volume of trolls and players who refuse to work as a team or accept advice from more experienced players this season.

Your team can't prevent you from climbing. You get the same kind of teammates as your enemies do, and for every game you lost just because of your teammates trolled, there's a game that you won just because someone on the enemy team trolled. That's just how statistcs work, every free loss is balanced out by a free win and the net result is just your own personal contribution since you're the only constant in all your games.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Confirmation_bias


At any rate, the same thing that happened to you would happen to the enemy. If both teams are equally affected by it, the net effect is null.

Which is sort of the point I'm making. You win 2 lose 2 because of these players being matched up with you and others similar to yourself and you go nowhere. Stuck in bronze forever. They need to be shuffled down to lower ranking divisions or not matched with players who have put in over 100+ wins.

Except it doesn't happen every single game. If you lose 2 games because of trolls on your team, win 2 times because of trolls in their team, then win 1 match on your own (meaning 80% of troll games, which is already way too high), then you'll be at 60% winrate, and all you need is to be above 50% to climb. If the system did enforce a 50% winrate on everyone, then nobody would ever climb at all and everyone would be on the same tier, from Faker to the fresh-into-level 30 guy. Which is not what happens at all, people climb and fall all the time.

Thats not nearly true. Statistics over 1,000,000 games may provide this to be true, but in my 1600 games I've experienced it to be untrue. I dont get a troll/feeder one game, then my enemy the next. I've played whole days with bad teams.

100 samples is more than enough to normalize a 50% probablity variable. 1000 samples is outright redundant. You are not a special individual cursed with bad luck, your experiences do not defy statistcs. It's all on you, not your teammates, and the sooner you understand that the better for you.

LOLOL sure and that is why they said Trump would lose.  100 samples is NOTHING.  1000 samples is nothing.  You have no clue how statistics work.

Sample sizes are only related to how many relevant variables there are, and in this case it's only one. Flipping a coin 20 times is more than enough to see if it's loaded or not, you don't need to flip it 100 times, and you definitely don't need to flip it 1000 times. What happened to Trump's polls was a matter of poor sample choice (not randomizing it properly), not of sample size. That and bought out and fraudulent polls, but it's neither here nor there. 

I can go on and prove it to you mathematically, but unless you have any idea of what confidence intervals and a z-test means, it will just go over your head. So I'll suggest you stop talking from your ass to people who know better than you.

One of the best for this is xin xao. He may be a bit boring to play but you can solo drags/baron easily with three items and he shreds towers quickly. Im finding that you need to dodge a lot and I mean a LOT of games just like this one.

The Pros dodge often if they are autofilled into a role they are not "good" with or if they see a team pick that is way out of meta.

1. SPECIALIZE. Pick 2 to 4 champions (1 champion is fine if he's never banned) and STICK to them. "Jack-of-all-trades and master of none" makes it harder to climb. But if you know a few champions INSIDE OUT and can carry with them through practice, it will make the whole thing easier. You want games to be predictable and to stick to your strengths (ex I mostly spam {{champion:8}}, {{champion:58}}, for the odd game I go {{champion:112}} and {{champion:22}}). You need to have a practiced Support for auto fill operations, preferably someone who can soft carry a game (ex {{champion:111}}). Its going to get boring at times playing less than 5 champs but you should stick to it, its very high reward. SPECIALIZATION is good for the economy, and its good for climbing too. 

2. Play solo lanes (Top and Mid), forget about Bot and forget about Jg. If you get to the point where you can win your solo lane 60-70% of the time it will help you climb massively. You have almost no control over who wins in Bot and Jg is very team reliant (and at higher levels, very mind-game-heavy). 1 vs 1 in Top or Mid is much easier to practice, perfect, and carry from. 

3. FOCUS THE DAMN TOWERS. Pretend its called League of Towers. Defend your Towers, take the enemy Towers. Your team does stupid tower dives instead of focusing the Towers? Ignore them and get safe damage on the Towers. Ping your team to take care of the Towers, pretend the Towers are Aircraft Carriers. You don't want to fight a naval war without them.

You literally sound like me pregame and in game. Alas, the ones who are focused on being good teammates and using teamwork listen or agree and we win. The ones who are like STFU I'LL DO WHAT I WANT are the ones who cost the loss. 

I used to play quinn top or mid only. Now I play anivia mid or morgana support. I'm thinking of going back to just queuing for top/mid as I climbed faster.

> I have over 150 wins in Ranked play this season, but I'm still in bronze 5. Why?

Because you don't play good enough to climb. Blaming it on bad teams, a bad ranked system, on tilting team mates, on anything but yourself is going to prevent you from climbing the ladder. If you don't realize that you're bad at the game you most likely won't improve any time soon.

> As a player with nearly 2000 games played I can offer advice to other players on what tactics to use to win a game or battle. But, how do most players receive that advice?

Since you're stuck in the lowest division possible, I have a hard time believing that you actually know what to do to win a game. Besides that nobody made you the team captain or shotcaller. Nobody has to listen to what you're saying. If I was concidered to be one of the worst players of the entire game not able to climb out of the lowest division and then someone who thinks he is better than me even though he probably isn't starts telling me what to do I wouldn't be happy either. No wonder you get negative responses

>  but mostly you get, "KYS", "STFU UR TRASH", etc.

Which will never change. People don't lose their toxicity once they reach a certain division.

> Reporting these players is fine, but that doesnt save your league points or advancement possibility.

Imagine this for a second. The next game you play will have a troll, afk or feeder. There is a 4/9 chance he will be on your team and a 5/9 chance he will be on the enemy team.
Therefore, if you manage to play consistently and have a good attitude, you'd climb BECAUSE of trolls, feeders and leavers. 
If we could look at all the games which were decided by things like that, you would probably have won more LP than you lost.

> Shouldn't I be playing with some more experienced players?

If atm you play like someone in Bronze 5, no. There are a lot of very experienced and also very bad players in Bronze 5 ... you included. You are not good at the game if you lose more games than you win, especially not against the worst players of the game

> It just seems that it's nearly impossible to rise out of bronze and silver with the volume of trolls and players who refuse to work as a team or accept advice from more experienced players this season.

I already mentioned that. If every single game had 1 troll, you would statistically win more than you lost, concidering you're not the troll.

The reason you're stuck in Bronze 5 is not because of trolls, flamers or people leaving games. There is only one single reason: You're bad at the game. If you want to improve yourself, complaining about teams and the ranked system won't help you at all. 

It's time to L2P  ... and I don't mean this ironically

While I appreciate that you took the time to tell me the problem is me, I have admitted in my post that sometimes I have a bad game.

Let me give you an example.

Monday of last week I made it to bronze 2. In that same day (im a disabled combat veteran so I play video games all day while my kids are at school), I played 8 games and lost 8 due to afk, trolls or feeders who wouldnt work as a team. Each game I played really well and was happy with my performance. At the end of the day I was back in bronze 4. 

I will continue to learn to play, and I watch videos and read guides. I watch the pros play consistently. The troll/bad player ratio is much higher than one per game. Its more like 2 - 3 per game. 

I wouldn't care if there were no trolls/bad players on the other team. I would enjoy a well balanced fight of equal ELO. Its no fun to win when the other team receives one of these players either.

Hoping the new honor system also adjusts who they get matched up to play with. Higher honor players playing together in matchmaking and lower honor players playing with each other.

Also, you seem to say similar things in posts to others. Even though you've never played with them or me, you still lay the blame on us.

https://gyazo.com/20fb29fe5140e401a0bac188d08472be

I guess we could just get bored of being matched up with these players, grinding for days on end to reach a higher ELO, just to be slammed back to bronze 5 and just quit playing the game. This would just leave the bad players and the trolls to play with each other while the more responsible players go play something else.

Frustrated with my teammates is the story I'm telling. Whether they be bad or bad on purpose, I'm ready to play with some like minded people.

Good day.
